Verified and indeed working using Virtual Clone Drive by Sly Soft BUT the ISO is still in Blu-ray format like the description states thus you will need a BD-ROM, BD-RE drive on your rig so the virtual drive can utilize it's drivers for a successful mount. On another note... nice work, aol! Greatly appreciated! KUTGreatW!

have you tried winrar n extract it

Download and install Daemon tools.

Download and install Power DVD.
http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/5602727/Cyberlink_Power_DVD_v10.0.1714.51_Ultra_Multilang_%28x32-x64%29

Connect an HDMI cable from your computer to your 3D TV/Monitor.

Mount the iSO in Daemon Tools.

Open your virtual drive from Power DVD

Enjoy!

(Please don't say stuff is crap unless you know what your talking about!)

I mounted the ISO ok (dameon tools didnt like it but MagicDisc did) and the bluray files are there, but PowerDVD 10 and WinDVD 2010 both said unrecognised format. Im on windows 7 64bit .. any ideas ?

ok I got it working, it has to be mounted with virtual clonedrive and watched with powerDVD 10. (no other virtual drives worked for me & I tried daemon, alcohol 120% and magic disk)

Also this contains both 2D and 3D versions, and as I havent got a 3D TV you can still watch it in the old red & cyan 3D glasses method, and it still looks excellent. 

massive respect to the uploader, this is a trip!
